ai.summary: Belmot to Lund is a gentle 5.5 km walk in the UK, suitable for families and casual walkers. The route is easy with mostly flat terrain and scenic rural views, suitable for a relaxed outing of about 1.5 to 2 hours depending on pace.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail follows well-marked footpaths with mostly flat to gently rolling ground. Expect a mix of compact soil, gravel, and occasional grassy or muddy patches after rain. Some sections may run along field margins with hedges; footing is generally easy but can be uneven near gates and stiles.
ai.safety_notes: Check the forecast and tide (if near coastline). Wear sturdy walking shoes and bring a light waterproof layer. Stay on marked paths, respect livestock and farm gates, and carry a map or GPS. Leave extra time for gates, stiles, and potential mud; carry water and a basic first aid item; ensure mobile signal if you need assistance.
recommended_gear: Map, printed or offline map, or GPS device
ai.best_seasons: Spring to early autumn (roughly April to September) offers the best conditions for this easy 5.5 km walk, though it can be completed year-round with appropriate clothing and footwear.

seo.title: Belmot to Lund: Easy 5.5 km UK Hike
seo.meta_description: Explore Belmot to Lund, a gentle 5.5 km hike in the UK. Easy terrain, practical gear tips, and safety notes for a family-friendly countryside walk.
